intro: Phyllagathis marumiaetricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyllagathis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant has small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces tiny, clustered white flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
